definitions.text: instrumentality that combines interrelated interacting artifacts designed to work as a coherent entity
examples: he bought a new stereo system
the system consists of a motor and a small computer

definitions.text: a group of independent but interrelated elements comprising a unified whole
examples: a vast system of production and distribution and consumption keep the country going

definitions.text: (physical chemistry) a sample of matter in which substances in different phases are in equilibrium
examples: in a static system oil cannot be replaced by water on a surface

definitions.text: a complex of methods or rules governing behavior
examples: they have to operate under a system they oppose
that language has a complex system for indicating gender

definitions.text: an organized structure for arranging or classifying
examples: he changed the arrangement of the topics
the facts were familiar but it was in the organization of them that he was original
he tried to understand their system of classification

definitions.text: a group of physiologically or anatomically related organs or parts
examples: the body has a system of organs for digestion

definitions.text: a procedure or process for obtaining an objective
examples: they had to devise a system that did not depend on cooperation

definitions.text: the living body considered as made up of interdependent components forming a unified whole
examples: exercise helped him get the alcohol out of his system

definitions.text: an ordered manner; orderliness by virtue of being methodical and well organized
examples: his compulsive organization was not an endearing quality
we can't do it unless we establish some system around here
